programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek dives into the lost Jowett marque, as a Bradford-built 1952 Javelin finds an unexpected home. Paul and Dave uncover a Ford Escort that's been untouched for 30 years.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
programme.desc: Neil Oliver leads the team to Cornwall and discovers the network of communication cables under Porthcurno beach. Miranda Krestovnikoff discovers how a shipwreck can be turned into a natural wildlife sanctuary, and Mark Horton visits the Isles of Scilly - known to some archaeologists as the Isles of the Dead.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is called in to investigate the murders of a ruthless businessman and his family, but still finds time for romance with an old flame. Meanwhile, a preoccupied Leo unwittingly puts his reputation on the line by dismissing a junior pathologist's doubts concerning the seemingly routine death of an elderly woman. Feature-length episode, starring Amanda Burton and Tom Ward.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuthing housewife investigates a spiritualist who appears to be blackmailing her customers, while Geoffrey falls in love, but his secret romance threatens to undermine Hetty's carefully laid trap - and nearly causes him to quit the agency.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leela investigates a 'happy slapping' incident. Tracing the teenage culprits to a nearby school, she finds they show no remorse. Amber, Ramani and Zain look into a case of domestic violence, only to find the circumstances aren't as clear-cut as they initially appeared. Back at the station, Dan Casper is teased about his seemingly non-existent love life, and Adam tries to quell gossip about the bogus Gabriel Kent's fatal fall.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies (2014)
programme.desc: Dwarf king Thorin reclaims control of his homeland, but his descent into madness places him on the brink of war with his human and elven allies. As Thorin's Hobbit friend Bilbo tries to save the tormented ruler from himself, a vast horde of orcs gathers to destroy them all. Conclusion of the fantasy adventure trilogy, starring Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, Ian McKellen, Luke Evans and Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The mining of precious opals beneath a hot desert, the making of nougat and how stunt planes are built.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China try to transform a Mini City 1000 to celebrate the car's 50th anniversary on a budget of £5,000

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. After buying a Mini City 1000 for £700, Mike Brewer plans to showcase the car at the three-day 50th birthday celebration of the vehicle in Birmingham. The only problem is that mechanic Edd China still has to complete the work necessary to restore it to its former glory.

programme.title: Explosions Gone Wrong
programme.desc: Experts examine the science behind big blasts and suggest how they can be prevented. Featuring footage of exploding buildings, roads, trains and other vehicles.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mikey Teutul leaves the show and Paul Jr confronts his father in an explosive meeting, while OCC finishes the Italian sports car bike and PJD unveils the Skil bike.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: The development of British bombers, including the Lancaster, the Wellington and the Blenheim.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe travels to Arizona and tries his hand at moving a giant cactus. He then he heads to Idaho to work with millions of maggots.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew travels to the birthplace of the McLaren 650S, to reveal its inner workings and admire its attractive exterior.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew heads to Michigan to construct a profile of the Falcon F7 supercar.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: After being reported missing, a young couple's bodies were discovered more than 60 miles apart. Dedicated investigators set out to find their killer.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The work of investigators and scientists at the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms who are dedicated to preventing terrorism and reducing violent crime.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Black Hat
programme.desc: The murder of student Julissa Brisman, found shot and bound in a hotel room in Boston. Police used cameras to find her killer and were shocked by what they uncovered.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of self-made millionaire Buddy Parker's 26-year-old daughter Tara Swilley, who died after the carpet company owner's home was raked with gunfire by an embittered business associate in August 2004.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into an armed robbery in which masked gunmen tied up employees at an armoured-truck depot and fled with $18.9million.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: SPCA's cruelty investigators are called to an affluent suburb in the Houston area to rescue horses from a property. However, for some animals, help has come too late.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is desperate to save the life of a frail three-day old foal that has just been orphaned. Plus, Dr Lisa Chimes is trying to help a greedy cat that ate a 50cm ribbon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kristin wants to find a rock 'n' roll wedding dress, while Amber has two priorities - an outfit that is different and which shows off her tattoos.
